dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.utterance: Good morning, Azul. Do you know who this is?

dialogue.utterance: Moco... What the hell do you want after all these years?

dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.utterance: That's sweet of you, asshole. I don't suppose you could get me out of there, and then maybe hand me over my share of money.

dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.utterance: I could stay in here and earn peanuts compared to what you owe me if I were to get out. So, yes, I want you to help me... my friend.

dialogue.speaker: MOCO

dialogue.utterance: Really? Well, that's more like it. Just like the Moco I used to know.
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.utterance: Just hang in there my friend. I won't forget that you have been a big part of our success. What's wrong.

dialogue.utterance: What do you want to drink?

dialogue.context: The other drinkers stare at him. Glancing around the room, Mariachi notices a small, table- shaped object draped with a cloth in one corner of the room. Sitting directly behind him are four mean-looking dudes. Mariachi is served his drink.

dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: No hay musica?

dialogue.utterance: Why?

dialogue.utterance: I'm a mariachi. A good one. I play beautiful ballads, old classic ballads, on an old-fashioned guitar.
dialogue.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogue.utterance: So what?

dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: I could add a little class to this place. I work for fairly cheap, I live mostly off tips. But I need steady work, and I can guarantee bringing in more customers.

dialogue.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogue.utterance: ... or I could spend the same money only get one little guitar player... Understand?
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: Thank you, sir.

dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.utterance: Bartender... one beer.

dialogue.utterance: No way. They were well-dressed men. I checked into the cheapest hotel in town, no money, nothing of value, except this guitar and maybe this coat, which they could have taken when I left my room, but they didn't. They were only interested in killing me.

dialogue.utterance: So why do you come here? You want to get me killed?

dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI

dialogue.utterance: Yes.

dialogue.utterance: Que paso

dialogue.speaker: MEAN DUDE #5

dialogue.speaker: MEAN DUDE #5

dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: Who are you?!

dialogue.utterance: We'll see...
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO

dialogue.utterance: You're very modest, Mariachi...
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO

dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: I'm a mariachi...

dialogue.utterance: Mondays are my day off. Want to play a game?
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.context: The phone rings. Domino gets up to answer it. Mariachi reaches under his blanket for a small mirror and combs his hair, putting spit in his hair to slick it down. He quickly stashes the mirror.
dialogue.utterance: Sure.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: Hello?
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.utterance: Come see me.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: I can't.
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.context: Moco is sitting at a table playing cards.
dialogue.utterance: Please.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: I don't feel well. I've got to go.
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.utterance: Have you ridden the bike?
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.context: She hangs up.
dialogue.utterance: No... I've got to go...
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: Boyfriend.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: No...

dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: I can't figure out something. You tell me you're poor. Poor family. Yet you've got this place.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: This place is a gift.
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: From who?
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: From Mauricio.
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: From Mauricio? The man trying to kill me?
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: He's not trying to kill you, his man had you confused with Azul.
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: Same thing.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: Look, you now how if you want to impress a girl, you send her flowers, candy, jewelry until you win her love?
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: Yes.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: If one present doesn't work, you keep sending bigger and better things until you win her or you're broke?
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: Correct...
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: Well, Mauricio sent me flowers, then jewelry, then he gave me a job at his saloon, then he gave me the whole saloon... etc.
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: He's still giving you things?
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: He'll never run out of money.

dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.context: Domino walks over to the counter and picks up a key.
dialogue.utterance: And you accept it all? What's the last thing he sent you?
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.context: Mariachi laughs.
dialogue.utterance: A motorcycle.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: He wants me to ride out to his ranch when I've decided to be his. He thinks he's close to having me.
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: Is he?
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.context: She sits next to Mariachi.
dialogue.utterance: He was.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.context: They kiss. She gets up and is about to turn off the lights.
dialogue.utterance: Not anymore.
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: So, you really are from a poor family.

dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: I remember when I was growing up, we were so poor, that my brothers and sisters and I all slept on the same blanket stretched out across the floor. We had to sleep in a circle, with our fingers in each other's ears, to keep the bugs from crawling into them.
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.context: Domino laughs.
dialogue.utterance: Ay, wey...

dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.context: Mariachi starts to put up his hand as if to refuse it.
dialogue.utterance: Here's a little bit I've saved. I want you to go get a new guitar.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.context: questioningly, then he shrugs an "OK" and grabs the money and jogs out excitedly. Domino is smiling.
dialogue.utterance: Take it, stupid. I'm not saying go by the best one, just a temporary one so you can play again tonight. Mariachi stops and thinks... He looks up at her

dialogue.speaker: MEAN DUDE #5
dialogue.context: Tracking shot following Mariachi. Tracking shot in front of Mean Dudes walking at Mariachi. Mean Dude 5 pulls out a small walkie-talkie and calls his buddy in the truck a block away.
dialogue.utterance: That's him...
dialogue.speaker: MEAN DUDE #5
dialogue.utterance: Loco, he's headed your way... black pants, white shirt.

dialogue.speaker: MEAN DUDE #5
dialogue.utterance: Where did he go, Loco?
dialogue.speaker: LOCO
dialogue.context: Mean Dude 5 laughs.
dialogue.utterance: He got in my truck.

dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.utterance: Where's my case?
dialogue.speaker: RAT #1
dialogue.utterance: We couldn't find it.
dialogue.speaker: RAT #2
dialogue.utterance: We heard they caught you and were taking you to Moco's ranch.
dialogue.speaker: RAT #1
dialogue.context: Azul thinks a moment. He stands up.
dialogue.utterance: ... so we came to see if it was true.
dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.context: Azul dresses, smiling...
dialogue.utterance: They caught the mariachi.

dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: What can I get you?
dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.context: She grabs a bottle and slams it down on the counter unopened. He eyes her admirably and then pops the top with one hand. He guzzles the drink, slamming it down empty.
dialogue.utterance: One beer.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: Anything else?
dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.utterance: My guitar case.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: Where's Mariachi?
dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.utterance: Where's my case?
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: Upstairs.

dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.context: Domino grabs another beer for him and runs to get the case. (In between this time, Mariachi escapes with Loco.) She returns, slamming it to the floor.
dialogue.utterance: Get it.
dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.utterance: If you want your mariachi back, come with me.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: Why will you help me?
dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.utterance: Because you know where Moco's ranch is... I don't. Domino calls her Assistant.
dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.utterance: You help me, I'll help you.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.context: They leave. The Assistant tends to the bar.
dialogue.utterance: Let's go.

dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.context: Azul grabs Domino and points a gun to her head. He whispers to her...
dialogue.utterance: Mauricio!!
dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.context: He kicks at the gate.
dialogue.utterance: Play along...

dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.context: Azul cocks the pistol.
dialogue.utterance: I'm sorry he used you to get to me, Domino.
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.utterance: Azul, let her go and you'll get your money.
dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.context: Moco signals his men to get the money.
dialogue.utterance: Moco, give me my money or I ruin your clothes with her blood.
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: What have you done with Mariachi?
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.utterance: Who?
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: The musician your men confused with Azul.
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.context: Azul is glancing between Domino and Moco.
dialogue.utterance: So that's why you were busy that night...
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.utterance: ... you had that little monkey climbing all over you.
dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.utterance: Give me my money or I kill her NOW!!!
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.utterance: After all I've done for you, this is how you treat me?
dialogue.speaker: DOMINO
dialogue.utterance: I never asked you for anything until now. Let Mariachi go.

dialogue.speaker: CONTINUED:
dialogue.utterance: Azul is anxious now.
dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.utterance: I swear I'll kill her!
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.context: Moco pulls out his gun and shoots her in the heart. She falls limp in Azul's arms. Azul tries hold her up, but she's dead. Azul rests her on the ground, looking down at her, wondering why it's all come to this.
dialogue.utterance: No you won't. I will.
dialogue.speaker: AZUL
dialogue.utterance: All I wanted was my rightful share. But you've got to kill everybody.
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.context: Azul slowly looks at Moco.
dialogue.utterance: You feel sorry for her, don't you? See, that's why you can't ever be as big as me.
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.context: Loco stops the truck and Mariachi gets out. Loco drives back when Mariachi motions for him to leave. Mariachi watches him go then dashes around the corner to the saloon.
dialogue.utterance: Stop here.
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: Domino!!! We're leaving!!! Right now!!!

dialogue.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogue.utterance: She's gone.
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI
dialogue.utterance: Where is she?
dialogue.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogue.context: Mariachi is about to race upstairs.
dialogue.utterance: Looking for you.
dialogue.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogue.context: Mariachi tries to make sense of it all for a minute before grabbing the gun from under the counter and rushing upstairs. INT. DOMINO'S LOFT - DAY Mariachi grabs the key to the motorcycle and runs out. The motorcycle burns down the road.
dialogue.utterance: She gave the case back to that guy. She left with him to find you.
dialogue.speaker: MARIACHI ON THE ROAD TO MOCO'S
dialogue.utterance: Mariachi barrels down the road on the motorcycle.
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.utterance: Bring that musician out here so he can be reunited with my Domino. Some men go to check. Cut back and forth with Mariachi coming.
dialogue.speaker: MEN
dialogue.utterance: He's gone, sir.
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.context: Mariachi rides through the semi-open gate... stopping at the bodies. He dismounts the bike and holds Domino. He has the gun in the back of his pants. You can see it while his back is to the camera and men are approaching him. Moco comes for the show.
dialogue.utterance: Find him!!

dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.context: Mariachi stands, hands up.
dialogue.utterance: You are very talented.
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.context: Mariachi says nothing.
dialogue.utterance: I bet you play the guitarra real well, huh?
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.context: Moco fires into Mariachi's left hand. Mariachi grimaces, crumbling to the floor. He keeps a tight grip on his hand. When he opens his hand to see the damage, the camera can see right through his hand for a reverse shot of his face through the hole.
dialogue.utterance: Not anymore.
dialogue.speaker: MOCO
dialogue.context: Moco is laughing and looking at his men for support, but no one else laughs. Mariachi tries to stand, but he falls back. When he rises again he has the gun in his hand. He shoots Moco in the chest. Moco falls back and hits the ground hard. He gasps for air... Moco's men gather around him. Mean Dude 5 crouches down to check Moco's throat pulse. Moco's dead. Mean Dude 5 strikes a match across Moco's face and lights up a cigarette. He turns and walks away. The others follow. Mariachi wraps a tourniquet on his arm, kisses Domino, opens Azul's case, sees the weapons, and rides off with it.
dialogue.utterance: Now get the hell off my property and take your hand with you!!!
